prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1:** Construct a 3D model of a ring with a hollow center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0979, 0.0]. Create the first face of the sketch by drawing a circle with center [0.375, 0.375] and radius 0.375 (loop_1). Create the second face of the sketch by drawing a circle with center [0.375, 0.375] and radius 0.3594 (loop_2). Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled sketch along the normal vector by 0.0489 units and along the opposite direction of normal by 0.0489 units. This completes the first part of the CAD assembly. **Instructions for Part 2:** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a pointed end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.375, 0.0394, -0.0917]. Create the first face of the sketch by drawing a series of connected lines. Start with a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to [0.1647, 0.0], then draw a line from [0.1647, 0.0] to [0.1647, 0.8417], followed by a line from [0.1647, 0.8417] to [0.1108, 0.8417], and finally draw a line from point [0.1108, 0.8417] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.8417. Extrude the scaled sketch along the normal vector by 0.1875 units and along the opposite direction of normal by 0.1875 units. Note that this operation cuts/removes materials from the existing CAD body. This completes the second part of the CAD assembly. **Instructions for Final Shape:** The final CAD model is a simple, three-dimensional shape with a curved, metallic-looking edge. This shape is a result of the previous two parts combined in the order they were created. The length of the final shape is approximately 0.75 units, the width is approximately 0.1 units, and the height is approximately 0.85 units.</description>
